predictions.text: The U.S. President will sign a full-year FY2026 DHS appropriations law (not a continuing resolution/stopgap) by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolved YES if an enrolled bill becomes law (Public Law) explicitly appropriating DHS for FY2026 through 2026-09-30 (or equivalent full-year duration). Resolved NO if no such law is signed by the deadline.
evidence: Shutdown/ICE funding uncertainty noted in NYT briefing (2026-02-03): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/03/briefing/shutdown-ice-funding-iran-drone.html
monitoring_signals: House/Senate Appropriations committee markups or released DHS bill text
CR extensions that exclude/include DHS
White House SAPs and signing statements
Congressional leadership deal announcements
predictions.rationale: Recent shutdown dynamics suggest near-term reliance on stopgaps; moving to a full-year DHS bill by end of March is plausible but politically difficult given ICE-related disputes.

predictions.text: The European Commission will open formal Digital Services Act (DSA) proceedings against X (Twitter) via a published Commission press release/statement by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if the European Commission publicly announces 'formal proceedings' (or equivalent DSA Article 66 language) against X by name. NO otherwise by deadline.
evidence: Europe digital sovereignty and scrutiny of X reported by AP (2026-02-03): https://apnews.com/article/europe-digital-sovereignty-big-tech-9f5388b68a0648514cebc8d92f682060
monitoring_signals: Commission DG CONNECT statements on VLOPs
DSA transparency database updates
French/EU regulator coordination announcements
X compliance/appeals filings and public responses
predictions.rationale: With heightened enforcement posture and cross-border pressure on U.S. platforms, a Commission step to formal proceedings is moderately likely within the next three months.

predictions.text: Neither OpenAI nor Nvidia will announce a completed equity investment by Nvidia into OpenAI by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if, by the deadline, there is no OpenAI or Nvidia press release, SEC filing, or earnings-call confirmation stating Nvidia made an equity investment in OpenAI (completed/closed). NO if such a completed investment is publicly confirmed.
evidence: Report that Nvidia–OpenAI mega-deal appears stalled (CNBC, 2026-02-03): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/03/nvidia-openai-stalled-on-their-mega-deal-ai-giants-need-each-other.html
monitoring_signals: Nvidia 10-Q/10-K notes on investments and related parties
OpenAI partner announcements and board/financing updates
Major compute contracting announcements that include equity components
Media reporting on term sheets converting to closed rounds
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting emphasizes negotiation friction; closing an equity deal would require governance and disclosure steps that often leak. Absence by end of June is somewhat more likely than closure.

predictions.text: The S&P 500 index will record at least one single-day close-to-close decline of 4.0% or more by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if any trading day shows (Close_today / Close_prior_close - 1) <= -0.040 on the S&P 500 (SPX). NO if no such day occurs by deadline.
evidence: Tech-led selloff dragging broader market noted by MarketWatch (2026-02-03): https://www.marketwatch.com/story/stocks-fall-as-s-p-500-dragged-down-by-tech-is-the-selling-over-ef6fff84
monitoring_signals: VIX level and term structure (backwardation)
Large-cap tech earnings surprises and guidance cuts
Credit spreads (IG/HY) widening and liquidity stress
Major geopolitical escalations affecting risk assets
predictions.rationale: Recent volatility is elevated, but a -4% day is still relatively rare over a ~2-month window; hence sub-50% despite risk-off tone.

predictions.text: LBMA gold spot (XAU/USD) will have at least one daily close at or above $5,250 by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if LBMA/benchmark spot gold close (or widely used reference close such as ICE/Reuters spot) is >= 5250.00 USD/oz on any date by deadline. NO otherwise.
evidence: Gold reported breaking above $5,000 amid risk-off tilt (CNBC, 2026-02-04): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/04/asia-markets-today-wednesday-wall-street-tech-selloff-futures-lower-ai-software-hang-seng-nikkei-kospi.html
monitoring_signals: Real yields (10y TIPS) and USD moves
Central bank gold purchase disclosures
Geopolitical shipping/energy shocks
COMEX positioning and margin changes
predictions.rationale: A move from just above $5,000 to $5,250 in ~2 months is plausible in a risk-off regime, but not the base case given potential mean reversion and policy uncertainty.

predictions.text: Y Combinator will publish updated standard funding documentation (or an official policy page) that explicitly allows founder funding disbursements in a named stablecoin (e.g., USDC/USDT) by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if YC posts (on ycombinator.com or an official YC repository) documentation/policy explicitly allowing disbursement in a named stablecoin. NO if no such official publication appears by deadline.
evidence: YC allowing founders to receive funding in stablecoins (Fortune, 2026-02-03): https://fortune.com/2026/02/03/famed-startup-incubator-y-combinator-to-let-founders-receive-funds-in-stablecoins/
monitoring_signals: YC SAFE template updates and public legal docs
YC blog posts about payments/treasury operations
Partner banks/payment processors supporting stablecoins
Regulatory developments affecting stablecoin transfers
predictions.rationale: After announcing operational support for stablecoin payouts, formalizing it in standard docs/policies is a common next step, though legal and compliance reviews could delay.

predictions.text: At least one of Moody’s, S&P Global Ratings, or Fitch will revise Oracle’s credit outlook to Negative (or place Oracle on Negative Watch) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if any of the three agencies publishes an action changing Oracle’s outlook to Negative or placing it on Rating Watch Negative by deadline. NO otherwise.
evidence: Oracle’s large debt financing raising AI funding/leverage concerns (MarketWatch, 2026-02-03): https://www.marketwatch.com/story/oracles-monster-25-billion-debt-financing-points-to-anxieties-around-ai-funding-b92c634b
monitoring_signals: Agency commentaries on leverage/FCF post-financing
Oracle quarterly net leverage and capex trajectory
Any announced additional large debt issuance
Data-center demand signals and pricing pressure
predictions.rationale: Even with a large financing, rating agencies often wait for sustained leverage deterioration; an outlook shift is possible but less likely without clear downside in cash flow or additional borrowing.

predictions.text: China will publicly announce the removal, suspension, or 'under investigation' status of at least one Central Military Commission (CMC) member or PLA service chief by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if Xinhua/State Council/CCP announcements or widely recognized official readouts state a named CMC member or PLA service chief is removed from post, suspended, or under investigation/disciplinary review. NO otherwise.
evidence: Reporting on leadership fractures/purges raising unpredictability (NYT, 2026-02-03): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/03/us/politics/china-xi-military-purge.html
monitoring_signals: Unexplained absences from major meetings and ceremonies
State media personnel announcements and NPC/CPPCC coverage
CCDI investigation notices
Reassignments in PLA senior command
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting suggests continued internal security/purge dynamics, but timing is uncertain and official confirmation may lag rumors, keeping probability below 50%.

predictions.text: USCENTCOM (or the U.S. Navy) will publicly confirm at least one additional kinetic engagement (shootdown/intercept) involving an Iranian drone near a U.S. naval vessel in the Middle East by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if an official CENTCOM/Navy statement confirms a drone (identified as Iranian or Iran-backed) was shot down/intercepted in proximity to a U.S. naval vessel in CENTCOM AOR by deadline. NO otherwise.
evidence: U.S. fighter jet shoots down Iranian drone near aircraft carrier (CNBC, 2026-02-03): https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/03/us-military-shoots-down-iranian-drone-that-aggressively-approached-aircraft-carrier.html
monitoring_signals: CENTCOM daily ops releases and press briefings
UKMTO/MSC incident reports in Gulf/Arabian Sea
Carrier strike group movements and public photos
Iranian IRGC statements about drone operations
predictions.rationale: A recent intercept indicates elevated operational tempo; repeat incidents are plausible but not certain due to potential de-escalation measures and changes in rules of engagement.

predictions.text: WHO will publish a public funding appeal/statement explicitly warning of neglected tropical disease (NTD) resurgence in Africa and requesting at least $100 million in additional funding by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if WHO issues a press release, donor appeal, or official statement explicitly linking Africa NTD resurgence risk to funding gaps and stating a requested additional amount >= USD 100,000,000. NO otherwise by deadline.
evidence: Warnings about NTD resurgence amid funding gaps (NYT, 2026-02-03): https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/03/health/neglected-tropical-diseases-usaid-ntds-river-blindness.html
monitoring_signals: WHO donor roundtables and emergency appeal pages
Major NGO/UN partner announcements (e.g., UNICEF, Gates-affiliated initiatives)
Reported program suspensions or stockouts for NTD treatments
Outbreak reports that cite NTD control lapses
predictions.rationale: The issue is salient and funding-driven, making an explicit appeal plausible over a year; however, WHO may route requests through partners or broader health financing vehicles, reducing certainty.
